reviewText: This was surprisingly tough; not that any of Kathy's videos are exceptionally "easy", but her choreography is generally not very complicated, which is why I like her videos. The video progresses into "wave" segments from easy to harder impact, then a few minutes of basic weights. There are two of these full segments all together. If you're trying to add something different to your routine, this is a good choice.
summary: Very good workout for those who need something new
Title: N/A

reviewText: OK, I gave this five stars cause it's THAT GOOD of a workout, but the tape is not perfect...First, the routine. It's a bit tricky to learn. Now, some of the reviews will lead you to believe you need dance training to do it, and while at first you may feel intimidated, I don't think it's beyond the average exerciser's grasp. The exercise "experts" at collegevideo.com (where this tape is more expensive) rate the choreography as "Moderate," so there ya go. It's not all that complicated.I think, however, the fact that the routine moves so swiftly makes it a bit hard to catch onto what, exactly, Kathy & co are doing. Also, a few of the moves have you turning your back to the TV, which confused the heck outta me at first. I tried yelling & cursing the screen, but eventually I just relaxed and followed as best I could and before long, they clicked. The moves really aren't that hard, you just have to get used to the change of direction.Kathy's cueing isn't that bad, either. I tried counting while I was doing the tape today and found three instances where Kathy miscued a move, that's all. Now, I was working pretty hard so maybe I didn't catch 'em all, but still.... And, it's not like all you have to go on is Kathy's voice, you have the whole routine to watch right in front of you! I like how she calls each new move before you do it, so you can prepare yourself. She also often calls moves as we're doing them, and I found myself calling along in the beginning -- it really helped me learn the steps.Now, after you learn the steps... WHOO HOOOO this is a fun workout!! I usually don't dig the dancey stuff, but I just love how this routine makes me feel so graceful & strong. I also think the intensity "waves" are key. It makes the 18 minutes FLY by, and lemme tell ya, you will sweat buckets! My cardio endurance improved by leaps and bounds, as well.The weight lifting segments, though... I'm not so fond of these. I work out w/ weights regularly anyway, and use this Fat Burning Breakthrough tape on my recovery days, so I don't push it. I use a low weight & focus on my form. I think if you wanna use heavier weights, be careful cause some of the moves (lateral raises in particular) seem a bit too fast for me and possibly could be dangerous. Take your time!So, to sum up: YES this is an EXCELLENT workout! Some of the steps may take some time to learn, but no biggie. Stick with it and after a few viewings you'll be catching on.Oh yeah, and you probably wanna lower your step when you start off. It makes learning the moves a lot easier, believe me!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This video has 2 major segments. You'll start with a short 14 minute progressive interval step sequence which is very easy to follow (although you may need to slow it down if you are a beginner). It starts gently and then increases in intensity through about a 4 minute peak of lunges, then cooldown slightly and start 4 minutes of arm weights. This progression then repeats (with different moves) for the second major segment. Then there is a series of 100 sit ups (20 of each type) and then a few moves to work on your back. Then there's a stretch.This is a great workout! I have never been so sweaty and felt so good in my life!I would recommend this video to anyone who is in decent cardiovascular health who wants to work out to their maximum capacity.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I just tried this video, and really do like it. I worked up quite the sweat, and now feel really good and loose, and also a little bit tired and shaky. (In a good way, though! :)Kathy, as always, knows her stuff, and her workout is safe and effective. I DID find, though, that there was a lot of "OK, now we're changing... here's the new thing..." without any explanation of the new thing. I did quite a bit of basic stepping while trying to figure out what was going on. I'm a belly dancer in my spare time, so I'm usually quite good with choreography, but somehow Kathy kept losing me!However, my heart rate monitor shows that I was working hard even while I was lost, so no worries. :)
summary: Good exercise, got lost with choreography
Title: N/A

reviewText: I have all of Kathy's other step tapes and I love this one the aboslute best!! I'm not the most coordinated person in the world, but it only took me a week to get the entire routine down. If you've done any of her tapes prior to this one, you will recognize a number of the moves. They are not that difficult to learn.I don't think of it as dancey, but I can see how others might think so. Personally that's what I LIKE about it. Like I said, I'm not the most coordinated person and being able to do this work out tape was a challenge and a triumph.Zone three in both segments is killer, but they're my favorite parts of the work out. Especially the second one. By the end I'm dripping sweat but for me a work out isn't a good one unless I drink almost all my bottle of water and I do with this one.If you want a work out that is interesting, challenging and works your body like nothing else, this is the tape for you.

reviewText: This is a fast-paced step workout with weight training intervals between the aerobics.  As usual Kathy and her cast seem to be having a good time while they are working out and she offers more advanced moves and modifications for those just starting out.  Good workout
Title: N/A

reviewText: Oh my goodness this workout is TOUGH. The warm-up alone will get your heart pumping, even if you're a regular exerciser (like me). Then after the first cardio wave, I found myself having to take a break before the toning (which I NEVER do with other step/cardio videos). The second wave is just as intense, and you're pretty much grateful (& thinner) when it's over. It's a challenging workout, but after about 4 tries, I can now finish without resting in the middle. The stepping is not tricky--it's the cueing that's off at times, but after seeing the video a couple of times, you CAN get the steps down. Probably should watch the video once before doing it. Intense step workout--you WILL lose weight with this one!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I have quite a few of Kathy's workouts and found this particular one to work me as hard as the Weight Loss Workout, which I loved but needed a change. And it's a change for sure with the advantage of the step which really increases the intensity of the cardio part, and really works your legs two. I thought I would like the wave concept, but when I do aerobics, I like to keep going and 20 minutes isn't enough for me, but for some reason, I find it hard to do it all over again because the intesity goes from high to low to high, but I guess I can learn to get used to this new concept. However, I've been doing both and I'm slowly but surely getting used to it. Not to mention the weight training really works up a sweat, but right now I'd rather do all 40 min aerobics, and all of the weights with out alternating, until like I said, I get used to it. Over all it's an excellent workout, a great way to challenge yourself, and definitely break those plateus. To sum it up I like Kathy's style because of her upbeat personality, and she leaves you with a great workout.
summary: Good for those who want a challenge!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This step video is from years ago, but doesn't look outdated like other DVDs I've seen.  The outfits are still current and the music is fun.  It's filmed outside in Hawaii and it's a nice change of scene from the typical studio backdrops.The DVD has two step workouts, which both raise heart rate and incorporate lots of squats and really get your thighs burning.  Then inbetween the two step workouts are short weight lifting segments.  This lifting segments require the use of barbells.Overall, I like to include this step dvd on days when I am also working my lower body because it has a lot of focus on leg strength.  The only two downsides to this video are the weight lifting segments are way too short to produce any results and the gals are holding VERY light weights that would never produce the muscles they have (you'd have to use heavier weights and do a REAL training session for that) and also Kathy Smith messes up some of her cues/lines and even has to ask the choreographer at one point how many moves are left.  Considering how famous she is and how much money she's brought in with her exercise programs, you'd think she'd take the time to memorize her lines.

reviewText: I'm an avid exerciser but I was still cardio challenged. I bought this video because I wanted to increase my cardiovascular endurance. I really enjoyed working out with this video because it made me work. Kathy teaches in a very professional manner. Her cueing was excellent and non-intimidating. The women in the video looked very healthy and not anorexic. I felt that their body types were more realistic to real women. The ab section was one of my favorites. I'm still a little winded afterwards but this is a challenging video(a real plateau buster) and I would recommend it to anyone starting an exercise program. I'm looking forward to exercising with it again.

reviewText: I thought I finished collecting step videos for my rotation until I found this one.  The box advertised a unique workout.  I already have 3 other Kathy Smith step videos (Step Workout, Power Step, and Buns & Thighs) and love them all, so I decided to try this one.  It was just what the box advertised.  The innovation in this workout is that the step series are in "waves".  The waves are made up of 5 zones.  The first zone is basic step that builds in intensity, the second zone is a little more challenging, the third zone is the most intense with lunges and squats, the fourth zone is a "recovery" period, and the final zone is toning using weights. Each zone lasts from 3 to 5 minutes for a total of 18 minutes for the entire wave.  There are two 18 minute waves.  The second one is a little more challenging than the first but, if you can do Kathy's Power Step video, you should not have a problem.  Zone 3 in the 2nd wave is very intense in that you expel a lot of energy doing the rapid lunges and squats while jumping across the bench.  If you dig deep and find that energy, the moves are not that difficult.  A nice thing about the waves is that each zone has a different combination, so you're not doing the same thing over and over and the workout stays fresh.  The weight sections put you through very basic moves that require dumbbells or hand weights. 3 to 5 pounders are probably sufficient, unless you are very buff.After the 2 waves, you get a nice abdominal workout.  It starts with two sets of push ups and then into abdominal crunch sets totaling 100 crunches.  It sounds like a lot, but it only lasts 4 minutes and the screen actually counts down how many you've done.  The cycling crunches at the end are very effective; I have never seen them done before on any of my other 25+ step tapes. Ab work is followed by a couple of back strengthening exercises. The total workout, including 7 minute warm up and 4 minute cool down stretch, is 52 minutes.  The workout is done outdoors which looks a little strange because of the shadows, but is still a nice change from studio backgrounds.  Unfortunately, unlike Kathy's other step videos, there are no cute guys in this one. You will not get bored with this video.  Give it a try!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is my first (probably last) Kathy Smith's video, but I workout everyday, so all the time I look for new workouts not to be board doing the same routines over and over.I bought this video with great expectations after reading the reviews. It was exactly what I was looking for: 50 minutes workout, hi energy, fun...When I actually tried it I found it to be very frustrating: the instructions are not clear and sometimes misleading, the choreography is too complicated to follow at home - she turns around all the time, so if I do what she does I find myself with my back to the TV, and this is the point when she makes a change in the move ... moreover, if I follow her exactly I find I do twice the same side. I tried doing the workout several times, because I liked the music etc - but thanks, I stay with Gilead, Karen Voight and even my old Jane FondaBottom line: If you know and love Kathy's style than you will probably love this one as well, otherwise - don't touch it.

reviewText: This video gives the body a wonderful workout, however it has its flaws. One, Kathy's cueing is a bit off and the moves are at times a little difficult. I had to lower my step and then I even did a little on the floor 'cause the moves were so intense. However, the weight portion of the video is great and the abs portion is also very good. Kathy does exactly 100 situps but they're varied, so it's not hard, but it is challenging. All in all, I think this video is a good addition to any workout, but just be careful and work at your own pace.

reviewText: This Kathy is a frequent flyer in my VCR.  The workout is intense and great for all level of fitness.  I had to do this tape for several weeks before I was in good enough shape to get all the way through the Wave 3 on the second session.  It really challenges you and the moves are varied so that you are working every part of your body.  The weight lifting on the tape is also comprehensive and hits all the major muscle groups.  Definitely get this Kathy workout!!

reviewText: The step routines are killer and, therefore, have to be beneficial for burning calories and building leg muscles. I always like it when a DVD  breaks the exercise routines into several segments so that, depending on the time you have at the moment, you have multiple options regarding your workout (from as little as 4 minutes with the abs section, and/or two separate 18 minutes with the step aerobics/brief target-training on the arms, and/or warm up & cool down segments as well). And you don't have to have an official step piece like the ones they use (although their ideal if you prefer to follow along exactly as displayed); I get along fine with a regular Rubbermaid-type small, step stool. I just have to adjust some of the moves since I can't step wide to the left & right. But even when I have to replace certain moves with the basic ones, I'm getting plenty of exercise still. In fact, my step stool measures 9 inches high and I saw on one of her other intro DVDs that one should progress up to 8 inches, so I don't feel like I'm missing out at all when I need to take brief breaks in between or when I replace some of those moves for the "basic" ones again. Anyway, you're going to sweat and you're going to feel your legs getting stronger. It's a great exercise DVD!
Title: N/A

reviewText: First, I want to say that I like Kathy Smith -I own 5 of her tapes and use them a lot. This one however, did not work for me. The problem is that the footwork is very complicated. I admit that I'm not the most coordinated person in the world, but I can usually keep up well enough to keep exercising. With this video, I got so confused with all the turns, side steps and step-ups at awkward angles, that I couldn't keep up with what they were doing. It was very frustrating. If you are looking for a good workout with relatively simple footwork (like me), this one isn't for you.

reviewText: I really enjoy this tape and use it often.  I particularly favor the 'zoning' or waves as she calls it.  3 zones that progressively get harder and each one definetly build on one another.  The end is a killer when your 'popping' up in the middle between side squats!  Defintely a worthwhile tape that uses time efficiently and pacts a lot of cardio into its zones.  I think having the weight training at the ends is a good idea, but dont think you're going to use heavy weights- more for toning so stick to the lower weights.
